messages.original: There is also an Iskander threat from Kursk. We will know if Iskander-K cruise missiles were launched from there in the next 10 minutes.
All 3 MiG-31K fighters landed at Savasleika, Nizhny Novgorod Oblast,
Iskander threat from Crimea
Iskander threat from Crimea
A launch was detected.
A launch was detected.
No ballistic missiles have been detected in Ukrainian airspace. This could be launches of Iskander-K cruise missiles.
No Iskander-K cruise missiles have been detected in Ukrainian airspace either.

@clement_molin
 has mapped around 4,000 Russian FAB glide-bomb strikes on frontline areas of Sumy so far in 2025.

Last night, Russia carried out a large-scale missile and drone attack on the city of Kremenchuk, Poltava Oblast. 
The following was used on the city:
- 2 Kinzhal hypersonic aeroballistic missiles launched from 2 MiG-31K fighters at their launch lines in eastern Tambov Oblast.
- 2 Iskander-M ballistic missiles, both equipped with cluster warheads, launched from OTRK installations near Kursk City, Kursk Oblast.
- At least 45 Geran-2 drones.
---------------
Of the missiles, 1 Kinzhal was intercepted by a Patriot system. The Ukrainian Airforce will naturally report this in their summary later on. Multiple Gerans were also shot down. 
The Gerans primarily targeted the Kremenchuk Oil Refinery, while the missiles likely targeted the main power plant. Large fires are burning at both facilities.
(Credit to "Intel Cams | OSINT" on YouTube for the second clip)

Last night, Russia carried out a large-scale missile and drone attack on the city of Kremenchuk, Poltava Oblast. 
The following was used on the city:
- 2 Kinzhal hypersonic aeroballistic missiles launched from 2 MiG-31K fighters at their launch lines in eastern Tambov Oblast.
- 2 Iskander-M ballistic missiles, both equipped with cluster warheads, launched from OTRK installations near Kursk City, Kursk Oblast.
- At least 45 Geran-2 drones.
---------------
Of the missiles, 1 Kinzhal was intercepted by a Patriot system. The Ukrainian Airforce will naturally report this in their summary later on. Multiple Gerans were also shot down. 
The Gerans primarily targeted the Kremenchuk Oil Refinery, while the missiles likely targeted the main power plant. Large fires are burning at both facilities.
(Credit to "Intel Cams | OSINT" on YouTube for the second clip)

Last night, Russia carried out another large-scale Geran-2 drone attack on the city of Fastiv, Kyiv Oblast.
At least 20 drones were used. It's unclear if they were targeting railway infrastructure again.

Last night, Russia carried out another large-scale Geran-2 drone attack on the city of Fastiv, Kyiv Oblast.
At least 20 drones were used. It's unclear if they were targeting railway infrastructure again.

This evening, Russian Geran-2 drones once again targeted Chernihiv Oblast.
Strikes were carried out on targets in Chernihiv City, Novhorod-Siverskyi, and Ripky. Both videos are from Novhorod-Siverskyi.

This evening, Russian Geran-2 drones once again targeted Chernihiv Oblast.
Strikes were carried out on targets in Chernihiv City, Novhorod-Siverskyi, and Ripky. Both videos are from Novhorod-Siverskyi.

Overnight, several Russian Geran-2 drones struck unknown targets in Ukrainian-controlled Donetsk Oblast.
The city of Slovyansk was hit the hardest, but impacts were also recorded in Kramatorsk and in the nearby town of Mykolaivka which hosts the Slovyansk Thermal Power Plant.

Overnight, several Russian Geran-2 drones struck unknown targets in Ukrainian-controlled Donetsk Oblast.
The city of Slovyansk was hit the hardest, but impacts were also recorded in Kramatorsk and in the nearby town of Mykolaivka which hosts the Slovyansk Thermal Power Plant.

Russian forces have captured the village of Orikhovo-Vasylivka, southern flank of Siversk, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~227.
Total land area: ~1.10 km¬≤.
The fighting for Orikhovo-Vasylivka lasted approximately 1 year, 27 days.

Russian forces have captured the village of Orikhovo-Vasylivka, southern flank of Siversk, Donetsk Oblast.  Pre-war population: ~227. Total land area: ~1.10 km¬≤.  The fighting for Orikhovo-Vasylivka lasted approximately 1 year, 27 days.

Due to the fall of Orikhovo-Vasylivka and the somewhat sudden Russian advances in the direction of Kramatorsk, Ukrainian forces have blown up the dam in the nearby village of Pryvillya.
Coordinates: 48.724099, 37.861442
Of the missiles, 1 Kinzhal was intercepted by a Patriot system.

Pro-Russians must be the only group to complain about a 99% success rate for their missiles getting through.

every single Iskander interception video supposedly being AI.

Well, an edited version of one the videos has been posted so I can share it here. 
This video shows Kinzhal debris falling just short of the oil refinery.
Obviously the Ukrainian airforce claim is false. One Kinzhal was shot down, not two.

Well, an edited version of one the videos has been posted so I can share it here.   This video shows Kinzhal debris falling just short of the oil refinery.  Obviously the Ukrainian airforce claim is false. One Kinzhal was shot down, not two.

This video recorded at exactly 1:30 am shows one Geran hitting (on the left), one Kinzhal hitting (centre) and two Iskanders with cluster warheads hitting (on the right).
I wonder where the second Kinzhal went?

Siversk Offensive: Ukrainian Defenses Collapse Near Yampil Amid Russian Advance¬†
Russian units have gained full control of the Yampil settlement on the Siversk sector. Russian army assault units are attempting to consolidate their positions in Liman. 
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy spoke with U.S. Presidential Special Envoy Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner over the phone.

Recruitment In Force: The Downside Of Ukrainian Mobilization
The
 situation in Ukraine grows more complicated with each passing month. Living in constant fear is pushing people to take radical measures. Reports of successful cases of forceful resistance to state authorities are becoming increasingly frequent, reflecting a shift in public attitude. People are beginning to feel supported within their communities, and a spirit of spontaneous solidarity‚Äîwhere strangers step in to help one another‚Äîis gaining ground.
This growing solidarity is not limited to passive support; the response to the arbitrariness of authorities increasingly involves active resistance, including violence. For example, several days ago in Lviv, during a routine "hunt" for potential conscripts, a TRC recruiter was attacked‚Äîstabbed and sprayed with pepper spray. He died from blood loss upon arriving at the hospital. The suspected killer, a 30-year-old man, showed no remorse for his actions. 
üëâ
 Read more 
HERE

Military Situation In Syria On December 7, 2025 (Map Update)

"Roads of Death" and Strikes on Logistics: Russian Forces Report New Successes in the Kupiansk Direction
Intense combat operations continue in the Kupiansk direction of Ukraine's Kharkiv Region. Russian assault units report advances in the northeastern part of Petropavlivka. Additionally, the Russian Ministry of Defense announced it has established control over the settlement of Kucherovka, located two kilometers east of Kupiansk. This village is situated on the highway leading to Svatove, and its capture could facilitate the expansion of control around Kupiansk‚Äîa key logistical hub in eastern Kharkiv Region.
Strikes on infrastructure are significantly impacting logistics. Strikes were carried out on the dam of the Pechenizke Reservoir and a road bridge in Staryi Saltiv. The Ukrainian side confirmed these strikes and reported damage that led to the temporary closure of highways T-21-11 and T-21-04. These routes were used to supply combat areas near Vovchansk and Kupiansk from Kharkiv. 
üëâ

HERE

The Zelensky Trap: A Chronicle of Ukraine‚Äôs Backroom Partition (November‚ÄìDecember 2025)
While the legacy media feeds the public pablum about ‚Äúunwavering support,‚Äù real politics is being forged behind closed doors. The first week of December 2025 drew a line under the old world order: Vladimir Zelensky finds himself in a unique historical trap. His ‚Äúenemy‚Äù (Russia) and his chief ‚Äúsponsor‚Äù (the US) are paradoxically offering him his only chance at survival, while his ‚Äúbest friends‚Äù (the Europeans) are pushing him toward the scaffold.
By December 2025, the geopolitical deck in the West has been reshuffled into a brutally simple configuration. Three distinct forces are now in play. First, Team Trump ‚Äî bulldozer pragmatists for whom Ukraine is just a toxic asset to be written off or restructured. Second, the Euro-bureaucracy and London ‚Äî Zelensky‚Äôs handlers, for whom keeping the war going is a matter of sheer political survival. 
üëâ
